did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Digital Libraries and Archives, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
did.unittitle:
A Guide to UIFA 13th Congress "Designing Environments for People before and after their Active Age"
2001

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the posters from the UIFA 13th Congress must be obtained from the Digital Library and Archives, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: A Guide to UIFA 13th Congress "Designing Environments for People before and after their Active Age" MS 2002-031, Special Collections, Digital Library and Archives, University Libraries, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, VA.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: As the population in Japan increased and longevity, especially of women, rose, the housing problem became the focus of many architectural firms. The Japanese members of the UIFA suggested that the 13th Congress of UIFA (held in Vienna, Austria July 1-10, 2001) be devoted to housing for the elderly. The official title of the Congress was broader, "Designing Environments for People before and after their Active Age", and the Japanese delegation presented several imaginative solutions for housing two or three generations under the same roof.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Comprised of posters, photographs, and exhibit panels, this artificially ammassed collection documents the exhibitions at the International Union of Women Architects (UIFA) 2001 held in Vienna, Austria July 1- 10, 2001. The Congress was entitled, "Designing Environments for People before and after their Active Age."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically by series. The collections is organized into series documenting each architects exhibit.
